Namespaces

The classes used in the current version of Simpatico are divided into four namespaces. The source code for each namespace is in a corresponding subdirectories of the src/directory: The Util namespace (in the src/util directory) contains general utilities for C++ programming and scientific computation. The Inter namespace (in the src/inter directory) contains classes that define specific potential energy functions, such as the Lennard-Jones pair potential. The McMd namespace (in the src/mcMd directory) contains classes required to construct single-processor Monte Carlo and molecular dynamics simulations, and the main programs to create the exectuables mcSim and mdSim. The DdMd namespace (and the src/ddMd directory) contains classes for a (still new) parallel domain-decomposition molecular dynamics code, and the main program for the corersponding ddSim executable.

Some of the most important classes in each namespace are introduced in the pages listed below. An alternate, and more complete, view of all of the classes in each namespace may be obtained clicking on the "Modules" link above and browsing a hierarchy of modules, each of which contains a sets of functionally related classes.
